org.javautil.util
Class DateFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.javautil.util.DateFactory

public class DateFactory
extends Object

Author:
jjs @ dbexperts.com Provides a simple way to get a date. The Standard Date constructors for Date are deprecated for good reason, they are goofy.

DateFactory

public DateFactory()

DateFactory

public DateFactory(GregorianCalendar pope)
Instantiate DateFactory using specified Calendar. Calendars are expensive to create, additionally you may want to tweak the time zone to affect what time midnight is.

Easy way to get a date (I'll skip the obvious jokes). All parameters are things a non programmer would expect. 
 public void test3() {
   
    Date karlsBirthDate = dateFactory.getDate(1988,4,8);
    Date wtf = new Date(88,3,8);
    assertEquals(karlsBirthDate,wtf);
    SimpleDateFormat sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss");
    String kjsFormat = sdf.format(karlsBirthDate);
    assertEquals("1988-04-08 00:00:00",kjsFormat);
  }
The parameters are not checked and the strangeness of the Calendar class prevails. Hence the 39th of March is April 8. * 
        Date aprilEighth = dateFactory.getDate(1988, 4, 8);
            Date thirtyNinthOfMarch = dateFactory.getDate(1988,3,39);
            assertEquals(aprilEighth,thirtyNinthOfMarch);

Parameters:
year - The year, for the year 2008 use 2008
month - 1 = Jan .. 12 = Dec
day - 1 - 31 as appropriate for month
hour - 0 - 23
minute - 0 - 60
second - 0 - 60
Returns:
